title: C.D. Olmedo
text:
Club Centro Deportivo Olmedo is an Ecuadorian professional <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Riobamba">Riobamba</a>, Ecuador. They play in the <a href="Ecuadorian%20Serie%20A">Serie A</a>.
The club won their only national championship in <a href="2000%20Campeonato%20Ecuatoriano%20de%20F%C3%BAtbol%20Serie%20A">2000</a>. Their achievement made them the first club outside <a href="Quito">Quito</a> and <a href="Guayaquil">Guayaquil</a> to win a national championship. They have also won two Serie B titles in 1994 and 2003. Internationally, they have played in the <a href="Copa%20Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a> four times, reaching the Round of 16 once in 2002.
Founded in 1919, Olmedo is one of the oldest clubs in the Serie A or Serie B. Their home stadium is the <a href="Estadio%20Ol%C3%ADmpico%20de%20Riobamba">Estadio Olímpico</a>, in the year 2000 they became the first club in the history of the Ecuadorian Serie A to win a league title that does not come from Quito or Guayaquil.
As of 2021 Olmedo is going through an economic crises that made them official bankrupt and could be dissolved at the end of the year.
Their biggest rivals are <a href="Club%20Social%20y%20Deportivo%20Macar%C3%A1">Macará</a> with whom they contest the "Clásico Interandino".
Current squad.
"As of 2020."
